Shavendra Silva | commander2 = [[Velupillai Prabhakaran]] | commander3 = | strength1 = | strength2 = | strength3 = | casualties1 = | casualties2 = | casualties3 = | notes = }} {{Campaignbox Eelam War IV}} {{Campaignbox Sri Lankan Civil War}} The '''Battle of Vidattaltivu''' was a military conflict over the town of [[Vidattaltivu]], [[Sri Lanka]] fought by the [[58 Division (Sri Lanka)|58 Division]] of the [[Military of Sri Lanka|Sri Lankan Military]] and the [[Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam]] (LTTE). The battle took place on July 16, 2008, part of the [[Northern Theater of Eelam War IV|Northern Theater]] of [[Eelam War IV]] during the [[Sri Lankan civil war]]. The 58 Division victory in the battle marked the first time the Army had been in control of the town in 21 years.{{cite news | last = Reddy | first = B. Muralidhar | title = Strategic Sea Tiger base captured | date = Thursday, Jul 17, 2008 | work = The Hindu | url = http://www.hindu.com/2008/07/17/stories/2008071755341600.htm | accessdate = 2009-06-11}} According to the [[Ministry of Defence (Sri Lanka)|Sri Lankan Ministry of Defence]], the town had been the primary base used by the LTTE for its water operations and had also served as their logistics hub, making the taking of the town by the Army a "fatal blow" to the LTTE.{{cite news | date = Thursday, July 17, 2008 | title = Sri Lankan military captures key northern town | url = http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2008\07\17\story_17-7-2008_pg4_14 | work = Daily Times | accessdate = 2009-04-11}} ==See also== *[[List of Sri Lankan Civil War battles]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{coord missing|Sri Lanka}} [[Category:Eelam War IV]] [[Category:Conflicts in 2008]] [[Category:2008 in Sri Lanka]] [[Category:Battles of the Sri Lankan Civil War]] [[no:Slaget om Vidattaltivu]]
